title: Streaking C.B. South downs Pennridge
text:
More coverage: Southeastern Pa. high school sports 
C.B South hasn't lost in seven games since, including a 3-0 victory over visiting Pennridge on Thursday, a contest in which the home team came out pressuring. 
"We got off to a great start," Fagan said. "It was a great shot by Colin Green and then the rest of the game we tried to build off of that and keep the ball as much as we could." 
Green put one away for C.B South (9-2-1, 7-2-1 league) less than two minutes into the first half, setting the tone early. 
From there, the Titans displayed terrific ball movement, utilizing the width of the field and excelling in transition. 
"Naturally we just tend to play a quick, passing-style game," Betts said. "We really want to move it around and move up the field as fast as we can. We just really wanted to get it up into the offensive third so we can get our scoring opportunities." 
The opportunities kept coming thanks to the play of Green and Fagan, midfielders who caused problems for the Rams (4-7, 3-7). Green finished with a goal and an assist, and Fagan scored the final two goals. 
"It's good that towards the end of the season we are in this kind of form," Green said. "If we can keep this going I think we will be in very good shape for the rest of the year." 
That will be tested next Tuesday, when the Titans face C.B. East, the team which beat them 5-0 and caused their soul-searching. 
That loss started the conversation between Brady and his captains. Then the gut check from the players. 
C.B. South is a different team now. 
And when the Titans step onto their home field to face the unbeaten Patriots, the Titans are hoping for a different result. 
Pennridge 0 0 - 0 
Central Bucks South 1 2 - 3 
Goals: CBS- Colin Fagan 2, Colin Green 
Saves: P- Brody Giblin 5; CBS- Matt Gorman 4.
